intro: Croton panduriformis, commonly known as the broadleaf croton, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers arranged in panicles, which are followed by distinctive, elongated, winged fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
